Introduction to Philosophy.

\[\begin{align*} \Huge\Phi\iota\lambda\omicron\sigma\omicron\phi\iota\alpha &= \text{love of wisdom}\\ \end{align*}\]

Description

This is an introduction to philosophy. It covers the central problems of the central subfields: ethics, philosophy of religion, metaphysics, epistemology.

  • There are two Course Readers: BOTH are required
    • Readings (purchase): Course Reader (purchase here)
    • Readings (download): Introduction to Philosophy - Course Reader

Lectures

Methodology: How to do Philosophy
Fine Art, Tragedy and Rhetoric Sophocles. Antigone
Film: Antigone (1961)
Science and Pseudo-Science Richard Feynman. Lectures on Physics
SEP. Scientific Method
SEP. Science and Pseudo-Science
Philosophy: Its Method and Value Plato. Apology
Plato. Gorgias: Socrates vs. Callicles
Bertrand Russell. The Value of Philosophy from Problems of Philosophy
Ethics: What should we do? How should we live?
Relativism Bernard Mandeville, Fable of the Bees
Gilbert Harman. 1975. Moral Relativism Defended
Joel Feinberg. "Psychological Egoism"
James and Stuart Rachels. "The Challenge of Cultural Relativism"
Utilitarianism Vsauce. The Trolley Problem in Real Life
John Stuart Mill. Utilitarianism
J. J. C. Smart and Bernard Williams. Utilitarianism: For and Against
Deontology Immanuel Kant. Groundwork of the Metaphysics of Morals
David Velleman. A Brief Introduction to Kantian Ethics
Virtue Ethics Aristotle (384-22 BCE). Nicomachean Ethics: Books I and II
Elizabeth M. Anscombe. 1958. Modern Moral Philosophy
Famine Relief Peter Singer. 1972. Famine, Affluence and Morality
Onora O'Neill. 1980. "Kantian Approaches to Some Famine Ethics"
Animal Welfare Peter Singer. Animal Liberation
Peter Singer. Lecture Animal Liberation, Forty Years On
Will Kymlicka. Lecture Membership Rights for Animals
SEP: The Moral Status of Animals
Political Philosophy: What is a just state or society?
Libertarianism Robert Nozick. Anarchy, State Utopia
Socialism Kai Neilsen. Socialism
Karl Marx. Communist Manifesto
Liberalism John Rawls. A Theory of Justice
Freewill and Causal Determinism: Do we ever act freely or make choices?
Freewill Libertarianism C. A. Cambpell. 1938. In Defence of Freewill
Hard-Determinism D'Holbach. 1770. XI. Of the System of Man's Free Agency from The System of Nature
Blatchford. 1908. Not Guilty
Compatibilism Ayer, A.J. 1972. Freedom and Necessity. In: Philosophical Essays. Palgrave Macmillan, London. doi
Harry Frankfurt. 1969. "Alternate Possibilities and Moral Responsibility," Journal of Philosophy, 46: 829-839.
Philosophy of Mind: What is a mind and mental phenomena?
Dualism Rene Descartes. Meditations
Richard Swineburne. Substance Dualism
SEP. Dualism
Behaviorism and Innatism B. F. Skinner. 1957. Verbal Behavior
Noam Chomsky. 1967. Review of B. F. Skinner, Verbal Behavior
Identity Theory J. J. C. Smart. 1959. "Sensations and Brain Processes", Philosophical Review, 68: 141–156.
Functionalism Ned Block. What is Functionalism?
SEP. Functionalism
Can Computers Think? Alan Turing. 1950. Computing Machinery and Intelligence, Mind, 59(236): 433-60.
John Searle. 1980. Minds, Brains and Programs, Behavioral and Brain Sciences, 3: 417-57.
Nick Bolstrom. Future Progress in Artificial Intelligence: A Survey of Expert Opinion
Nick Bolstrom. The Ethics of Artificial Intelligence
Philosophy of Religion: Does God Exist?
Ontological Argument for God St. Anselm. Proslogion
Gaunilo. On Behalf of the Fool
Immanuel Kant. Existence is not a predicate from Critique of Pure Reason (2) - The Dialectic
Cosmological Argument for God St. Thomas Aquinas. Summa
Design Argument for God William Paley. 1802. Natural Theology
David Hume. 1779. Dialogues Concerning Natural Religion
Roger Penrose. On Universe Fine-TuningYT
Leonard Suskind. Is the Universe Fine-Tuned for Life and Mind?YT
SEP. Fine-Tuning Argument
SEP. Teleological Arguments
Pragmatic Argument for God Blaise Pascal. 1660. Pensees
SEP. Pascal's Wager
The Logical Problem of Evil J. L. Mackie. 1955. Evil and Omnipotence
The Inductive Problem of Evil David Hume. 1779. Dialogues Concerning Natural Religion
SEP. The Problem of Evil
Epistemology
Skepticism Clifford. Ethics of Belief
William James. The Will to Believe
Sextus Empiricus (~300BCE). Outlines of Skepticism.
External World Skepticism Rene Descartes. 1641. Meditations I, II
Nick Bolstrom. 2003. Are you living in a computer simulation?. More here
The Problem of Induction David Hume. 1740. A Treatise of Human Nature: Abstract
David Hume. 1748. Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding (audio available)
Innate Knowledge or "Tabular Rasa" Plato. Meno
John Locke. Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding - Book I
A priori Knowledge Bertrand Russell.Problems of Philosophy, Chapter VII and VIII.
A. J. Ayer. Language, Truth and Logic. A priori
Metaphysics
Realism Bertrand Russell. Appearance and Reality from Problems of Philosophy
John Locke. Essay on Human Understanding: Book II, Book IV
Idealism George Berkeley. The Principles of Human Knowledge
Truth Bertand Russell. Truth in Problems of Philosophy
William James. VIII. The Pragmatist Account of Truth in The Meaning of Truth
